isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING FANS - OPERATION - CUMMINS M11, N14

svcprocinfo.para: Operation of fan clutch systems for Cummins M11, N14 engines.

svcsubproc.title: Horton Engine Fan Controls W/ECM Control System
svcsubproc.para: To Turn The Fan OFF:The ECM applies 12 volts through the nine-way ECM Interface connector (251) to circuit 23A, which is connected to the normally closed AC high pressure switch (228), which then applies the voltage on circuit 23D to the fan solenoid (227), causing the solenoid to energize, turning OFFthe air pressure which keeps the fan engaged. The fan is spring loaded in the disengaged position.
Turning The Fan ON:The fan is turned ON two ways:

item.para: When the ECM senses the engine coolant has reached the preset temperature limit, the ECM turns OFFthe voltage to circuit 23D. This causes the fan solenoid to de-energize, which applies air pressure to the fan clutch engaging the fan.

The second way the fan is turned ON is when the AC compressor head pressure exceeds 300 psi, the AC High Pressure switch (228) opens the fan solenoid circuit. This causes the fan solenoid to de-energize, which applies air pressure to the fan clutch engaging the fan. When the AC head pressure drops below 210 psi, the switch closes, energizing the fan solenoid and the fan turns OFF.

svcsubproc.title: Horton Engine Fan Controls W/Index K7A Control System
svcsubproc.para: Index Fan Switch (226) -The Index fan switch (226) receives ignition voltage from 10A fuse F9-A on circuit 23. The switch is grounded by circuit 23-G. The fan temperature switch opens (turning fan ON) when engine temperature exceeds 205°F or if the air conditioning (A/C) compressor head pressure exceeds 270 psi. When engine temperature drops below 198°F (or head pressure drops below 255 psi) the fan will remain ON for 3 more minutes (to prevent rapid fan cycling) then turn OFF.

The switch is closed when engine temperature is less than 198°F. With the switch closed ignition power is applied through circuit 23D (23E with Caterpillar 3406E) to energize the normally open solenoid. With the solenoid energized (closed) air pressure is removed from the fan clutch causing the clutch to disengage (Horton fan is spring loaded OFF).
The fan is turned ON under two conditions.

item.para: If engine temperature is greater than 205°F, the fan temperature switch opens, turning OFF power to the fan solenoid. With the solenoid de-energized air pressure is applied to the fan clutch causing the fan to engage after a 3 minute time delay.

The Index K7A switch is connected by circuit 23C to the A/C pressure switch on the A/C compressor. The pressure switch is normally closed, grounding the fan temperature switch. If compressor head pressure exceeds 270 psi, the switch opens the ground path from the fan temperature switch, which opens the fan temperature switch turning OFF the power to the fan solenoid. With the solenoid de-energized air pressure is applied to the fan clutch causing the fan to engage after a 3 minute time delay.

svcsubproc.title: Kysor Engine Fan Controls W/Index K7A Control System
svcsubproc.para: To Turn The Fan OFF:The ECM applies 12 volts through the nine-way ECM Interface connector (251) to circuit 23A, which is connected to the normally closed AC high pressure switch (228), which then applies the voltage on circuit 23D to the fan solenoid (227), causing the solenoid to energize, turning ONthe air pressure which overrides the fan clutch spring, turning the fan OFF.
Turning The Fan ON:The fan is turned ON two ways:

item.para: When the ECM senses the engine coolant has reached the preset temperature limit, the ECM turns OFFthe voltage to circuit 23D. This causes the fan solenoid to de-energize, which removes air pressure from the fan clutch, permitting the fan clutch spring to engage the fan.

The second way the fan is turned ON is when the AC compressor head pressure exceeds 300 psi, the AC High Pressure switch (228) opens the fan solenoid circuit. This causes the fan solenoid to de-energize, which turns OFF air pressure to the fan clutch permitting the fan clutch spring to engage the fan. When the AC head pressure drops below 210 psi, the switch closes, energizing the fan solenoid and the fan turns OFF.
